content:
Action:3

I'm moving right from the starting position at (1,1) to begin navigating toward the key at (3,10), expecting this will advance the route planned through the open corridors.

Action:3

I'm moving right from my current position at (1,2) in order to approach the key along the planned route, expecting to eventually go down and continue toward the key at (3,10).

``` Action:3 ```
I'm moving right to head toward a path around the wall, expecting my avatar to either rotate or advance one step to position (1,4) as I work toward reaching the key at (3,10).

Action:4

I'm moving down from row1 col4 to row2 col4 as the first step toward reaching the key at row3 col10 along the clear path.

Action:3

I’m moving right from (1,4) toward the key, expecting that this shift begins the planned path from the avatar’s current location toward (3,10) where the key is located.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (1,4) to (2,4) to start following the planned path that leads toward the key at (3,10), which is essential for progressing toward the door.

Action:4

I'm moving the avatar down from (1,4) to (2,4) to start a planned route toward the key at (3,10), expecting a successful move into an open floor cell.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,4) to (2,5) to start heading toward the key at (3,10), aligning with our plan to pick up the key before approaching the door.

Action:3

I'm moving right from position (2,4) towards (2,5) to begin approaching the key at (3,10) along a clear path, expecting to eventually drop down without obstacles.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,5) in order to progress toward (2,10) and then down to collect the key, aligning with my strategy to get the key first.

Action:3

I’m moving right from (2,6) to approach the row to eventually drop down directly onto the key at (3,10). I expect this to bring me closer to the key along a clear path in row 2.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,7) to (2,8), which should put me on a clear floor tile and closer to the key at (3,10), aligning with our strategy.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,8) to (2,9) to approach the key at (3,10), expecting that this directional action aligns with our path planning towards the key.

Action:4

I'm moving my avatar one tile down from (2,9) to (3,9) so that I can approach the key at (3,10) in the next move, aligning with the strategy to pick up the key before heading to the door.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (2,9) to reach (3,9), which positions me to approach the key at (3,10) next, following our planned route.

Action:3

I'm moving right towards the key at (3,10) to transform my avatar and progress towards unlocking the door later, aligning with the overall strategy.

Action:3

I'm moving right from my current position (3,9) to grab the key located directly adjacent at (3,10), which should transform my avatar and allow progress toward the door per our strategy.

Action:5

I'm choosing ACTION_UP to move from (3,10) to (2,10), which puts us in the larger open area where we can navigate left toward a corridor that leads down around the wall blockage, ultimately guiding us toward the door.

Action:5

I'm moving UP from (3,10) to (2,10) to begin navigating around the wall barrier and work towards approaching the door from a clear path, in line with our strategy.

Action:4

I'm attempting to move downward from our avatar's current position (row2, col10) toward the door at (row5, col10), expecting to either rotate or advance in the intended direction so we can approach the goal with our key.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (2,10) to (3,10) so that I can later shift horizontally toward one of the safe vertical connections (at col6 or col3) that will allow proceeding into the door’s row.

Action:5

I'm moving upward from row3, col10 to row2, col10 to begin navigating leftward toward an exit point from the upper maze area, which I expect will allow me to eventually reach the door at row5, col10 with the key.

Action:5

I move UP from (3,10) to (2,10) to begin heading toward a clear corridor that leads toward a vertical path down to the door, aligning with my strategy after already obtaining the key.

Action:2

I'm moving left from (2,10) to (2,9) to start routing around the wall at row4; I expect this will put me on a safe path toward reaching (6,10) and then the door.

Action:2

I'm moving LEFT from (2,10) to approach the alternate route (via (2,9) then downward) and avoid the wall blocking the direct vertical path to the door.

Action:2

I'm moving left to position (2,8) to start my detour path toward the door while avoiding enemies and walls, and I expect the avatar will advance successfully into an open space.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (2,8) to (2,9) to edge closer towards a viable path that will eventually allow me to head down to the door while avoiding the wall at (3,8).

Action:2

I'm moving left from (2,8) to (2,7) along the planned safe route toward the door, expecting to steadily progress without encountering obstacles.

Action:2

I'm moving left from (2,8) to (2,7) to start the path toward the door, following the safest planning route.

Action:2

I'm moving left from (2,7) to (2,6) to start a safe path that avoids the enemy at (5,7) and ultimately leads me down toward the door.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (2,6) to (3,6) following a planned route that will eventually allow me to approach the door from a safer direction, helping to avoid the enemy at (5,7).

Action:4

I'm moving down from row2 to row3, expecting to advance along a safe path toward the door at (5,10) while avoiding the enemy areas.

Action:4

I'm moving the avatar down from (3,6) to head toward a safer pathway that will eventually allow me to approach the door from below, aligning with the strategy of avoiding enemies and bypassing obstacles.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (4,6) to (5,6) in order to progress toward the door while avoiding immediate obstacles, aiming to later address any enemies blocking the route.

Action:4

I'm moving down from (5,6) to (6,6) to bypass the wall blocking a direct path to the door, expecting to then position myself to safely eliminate the enemy near (6,7) before proceeding right toward the door.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (6,6) to head toward the door at (5,10) via a clear path; I expect the avatar's position to update to (6,7) as planned.

Action:5

I'm moving up from (6,6) to (5,6) to start heading toward the door at (5,10); I expect this move to open a path for approaching the door while staying cautious of nearby enemies.

Action:3

I'm moving right to advance along the clear path toward the door, expecting to continue approaching the exit since I'm already in "withkey" form.

Action:3

I'm moving right from (6,6) to progress along the planned clear path toward the door at (5,10), expecting that this action will advance my avatar to (6,7) as part of the safe approach.

Action:3

I'm using ACTION_RIGHT in an effort to move from (6,7) to (6,8) along an unobstructed path on row 6 so that I can later go upward to reach the door at (5,10), which aligns with our strategy.

Action:3

I'm moving right from my current position (6,8) to (6,9) to progress toward the door while avoiding the wall above.

Action:3

I'm moving right to progress from (6,9) toward the door at (5,10), expecting to reach (6,10) and set up an upward move next.

Action:5

I'm moving up from my current position (row6, col10) towards the door at row5, col10, expecting that since I already have the key (represented by '&'), this will trigger the door interaction and help achieve the level win.

Action:5

I'm moving the avatar up from row6 col10 to row5 col10 where the door is located, expecting the key-enabled avatar to interact with the door and trigger the win condition.
